comments:
The methods getBundle() and getDialogSettings() fail if called from the 
constructor of a plugin class extending AbstractUIPlugin in case you are not 
including "org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility" in your plugin project and 
using the non-deprecated constructor AbstractUIPlugin(). I conclude from the 
stack trace that the class must be instatianted and registered before the OSGI 
functionality is able to construct the bundle (see stacktrace below). In case 
of getDialogSettings() this causes problems because I would like to get these 
in the constructor in order to initialize my application.

Regards
Richard

Calling getStateLocation() from the constructor causes an NPE in
DataArea.getStateLocation.

Please let me know if any change is needed in UI land.

The window is slightly different in 3.0 but the same idea as in 2.1. There is a 
point in time between constructing the plugin object and actually starting the 
plugin where the plugin is not fully initialized.  As such, the constructor 
code cannot assume that the plugin is initialized (started).  

Closing as invalid

traces.message: The activator  com.sap.ide.eclipse.rdebug.JrdebugecPlugin for bundle  com.sap.ide.eclipse.rdebug is invalid
